meanings.definition: Existing or occurring above the level of vitality.
meanings.sent1: The supravital energy of the sun kept the plants alive even in harsh conditions.
meanings.sent2: The doctor was amazed by the supravital signs of the patient, showing extraordinary resilience.
meanings.sent3: The supravital glow of the fireflies made the night magical.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a supravital spark in the dull room, brightening everyone's mood.
meanings.sent5: The supravital colors of the sunset painted the sky in breathtaking hues.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to processes or phenomena that occur outside of the normal functioning of living organisms.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the supravital reactions of the chemicals in the lab.
meanings.sent2: The mystery novel delved into the supravital activities of the secret society.
meanings.sent3: The cat's supravital curiosity led it to explore every nook and cranny of the house.
meanings.sent4: The supravital whispers in the haunted house sent shivers down their spines.
meanings.sent5: The supravital growth of the mutant plant fascinated the botanist.
